test-case.name: tunnel-0101
test-case.description: Simple test with a tunnel param specified within xsl:apply-templates and tunnel="yes"

test-case.name: tunnel-0102
test-case.description: Simple test with a tunnel param specified within xsl:apply-templates and tunnel="no"

test-case.name: tunnel-0103
test-case.description: Simple test with a non-tunnel param specified within xsl:apply-templates but template param has tunnel="yes"

test-case.name: tunnel-0104
test-case.description: Simple test with a tunnel param specified within xsl:call-template

test-case.name: tunnel-0105
test-case.description: Simple test with a tunnel param specified within xsl:call-template but template param has tunnel="no"

test-case.name: tunnel-0106
test-case.description: Simple test with a tunnel param specified within xsl:call-template and the tunnel param value is later retrieved

test-case.name: tunnel-0107
test-case.description: test tunnel param specified within xsl:call-template and another tunnel param overrides the value

test-case.name: tunnel-0108
test-case.description: test tunnel param specified within xsl:call-template and another non-tunnel param with the same name should not override the value

modified.change: change test to avoid error XTSE0680. See bug 10534

test-case.name: tunnel-0109
test-case.description: Simple test with a non-tunnel param specified within xsl:call-template but template param has tunnel="yes"

modified.change: change to expect error XTSE0680. See bug 10534

test-case.name: tunnel-0110
test-case.description: test tunnel params and non-tunnel params within xsl:call-template

modified.change: change to expect error XTSE0680. See bug 10534

test-case.name: tunnel-0111
test-case.description: test tunnel params with same local name but different namespace specified within xsl:call-template

test-case.name: tunnel-0112
test-case.description: test empty base set within stylesheet function using call-template

test-case.name: tunnel-0113
test-case.description: test empty base set within stylesheet function using call-template

modified.change: change test to avoid error XTSE0680. See bug 10534

test-case.name: tunnel-0114
test-case.description: Test case to show that initial template (xsl:template match="/") does not get any tunnel parameters.

test-case.name: tunnel-0115
test-case.description: Tests setting the value of tunnel attribute to an empty string(tunnel="") in xsl:with-param.

test-case.name: tunnel-0116
test-case.description: Tests setting the value of tunnel attribute to an empty string(tunnel="") in xsl:param.

test-case.name: tunnel-0117
test-case.description: Simple test with a non-tunnel param (tunnel="false") specified within xsl:apply-templates but template param has tunnel="true"

test-case.name: tunnel-0118
test-case.description: Simple test with a tunnel param (tunnel="true") specified within xsl:call-template but template param has tunnel="false"

test-case.name: tunnel-0119
test-case.description: Simple test with a non-tunnel param (tunnel="0") specified within xsl:apply-templates but template param has tunnel="1"

test-case.name: tunnel-0120
test-case.description: Simple test with a tunnel param (tunnel="1") specified within xsl:call-template but template param has tunnel="0"

test-case.name: tunnel-0201
test-case.description: Simple test with a tunnel param specified within xsl:apply-templates and the tunnel param value is later retrieved

test-case.name: tunnel-0202
test-case.description: test tunnel param specified within xsl:apply-templates and another tunnel param overrides the value

test-case.name: tunnel-0203
test-case.description: test tunnel param specified within xsl:apply-templates and another non-tunnel param with the same name should not override the value

test-case.name: tunnel-0204
test-case.description: test tunnel param specified within xsl:apply-templates and a global param that should be ignored

test-case.name: tunnel-0205
test-case.description: test tunnel params with same local name but different namespace specified within xsl:apply-templates

test-case.name: tunnel-0206
test-case.description: test empty base set within stylesheet function using xsl:apply-templates and tunnel="yes"

test-case.name: tunnel-0207
test-case.description: test empty base set within stylesheet function using xsl:apply-templates and tunnel="no"

test-case.name: tunnel-0208
test-case.description: simple test of tunnel params passed from xsl:apply-imports

test-case.name: tunnel-0209
test-case.description: test tunnel param overriden by another tunnel param in xsl:apply-imports

test-case.name: tunnel-0210
test-case.description: simple test of tunnel params passed from xsl:next-match

test-case.name: tunnel-0211
test-case.description: test tunnel param overriden by another tunnel param in xsl:next-match

test-case.name: tunnel-0212
test-case.description: Tests the name clash between tunnel parameter and explicit parameter defined in templates.

test-case.name: tunnel-0213
test-case.description: Test tunnel parameters with attributes tunnel="yes" and tunnel="no" where the first matched element is the document element.

test-case.name: tunnel-0214
test-case.description: Test different combinations of tunnel parameters and non-tunnel parameters within xsl:apply-templates.

test-case.name: tunnel-0215
test-case.description: Tests tunnel parameters specified within xsl:call-templates instruction with identical names as the global variables.

modified.change: change test to avoid error XTSE0680. See bug 10534

test-case.name: tunnel-0216
test-case.description: Tests the tunnel parameters specified within xsl:apply-imports with both tunnel="no" and tunnel="yes" attributes.

test-case.name: tunnel-0217
test-case.description: Tests the application of two the tunnel parameters specified within xsl:apply-imports where the latter overrides the value of the first one defined.

test-case.name: tunnel-0218
test-case.description: Tests the tunnel parameter and non-tunnel parameters with the identical names specified within xsl:apply-imports.

test-case.name: tunnel-0219
test-case.description: Tests tunnel parameters with the same local name but different namespace specified within xsl:apply-imports.

test-case.name: tunnel-0220
test-case.description: Tests tunnel parameter specified within xsl:apply-imports and a global parameter with an identical name as the tunnel parameter.

test-case.name: tunnel-0221
test-case.description: Tests tunnel parameters specified withing xsl:apply-imports with two imported templates.

test-case.name: tunnel-0222
test-case.description: Tests tunnel parameters specified within xsl:apply-imports with imported templates while the imported template to this stylesheet has an imported template itself.

test-case.name: tunnel-0223
test-case.description: Tests tunnel parameters specified within xsl:next-match with two imported templates.

test-case.name: tunnel-0224
test-case.description: Tests tunnel parameters specified within xsl:next-match with imported templates while the imported template to this stylesheet has an imported template itself.

test-case.name: tunnel-0225
test-case.description: Tests the tunnel parameters specified within xsl:next-match with the attribute tunnel="no", tunnel="yes" and also specifying no tunnel attribute.

test-case.name: tunnel-0226
test-case.description: Tests tunnel parameters with the same local name but different namespace specified within xsl:next-match.

test-case.name: tunnel-0227
test-case.description: Tests tunnel parameter specified within xsl:next-match and a global parameter with an identical name as the tunnel parameter.

test-case.name: tunnel-0301
test-case.description: Test case to verify that using a tunnel param does not remove it from the set, which means it can be re-used at lower levels.

result.assert-xml: <out> Parameter par1 inside doc element: foo Parameter par1 inside data element: foo Parameter par1 inside e2 element: foo</out>

test-case.name: tunnel-0302
test-case.description: Test case to show tunnel parameters passing through built-in templates.

result.assert-xml: <out> Parameter par1 inside e2 element: foo</out>

test-case.name: tunnel-0303
test-case.description: Tests xsl:param at the stylesheet level with @tunnel="no" and tunnel="yes" The parameter will be ignored in both cases and will not be tunnelled.

test-case.name: tunnel-0304
test-case.description: Test case to verify that the effect of default is only local; the parameter continues in the tunnel in an unset status.

result.assert-xml: <out><data>value of par1 inside data element:123</data><e2>value of par1 inside e2 element:</e2></out>

test-case.name: tunnel-0401
test-case.description: Test case to illustrate the accumulation of tunnel parameters from different nesting levels.

test-case.name: tunnel-0402
test-case.description: Test case to show that if a template with an override calls or applies another, the effect of the override is not passed to the next level.

result.assert-xml: <out> X inside A: A1 and Y inside A: A2 Y inside C: B1 and Z inside C: B2 X inside D: A1 and Y inside D: A2 </out>

test-case.name: tunnel-0403
test-case.description: Test case to show a pseudo-clash between the name of a param passed explicitly and a tunnel param from higher up that is not mentioned at either level of explicit pass but is used lower down.

test-case.name: tunnel-0404
test-case.description: Test case where launch specifies a named template as initial template and that template gets no tunnel params.

test-case.name: tunnel-0405
test-case.description: Test case for testing an empty base set using a top-level variable and a top-level param. Both the xsl:variable and xsl:param call a template that is also called from within xsl:template that has established a base set.

test-case.name: tunnel-0406
test-case.description: Test case where the intial template launches on an element other than root. Initially the template gets invoked and does not have any tunnel parameters. Further processing would invoke another template which is aimed to be called on the same initial node and passes some tunnel parameters to it.

result.assert-xml: <out>Parameter foo is: default_value</out><out>Parameter foo is: passed_value</out>

test-case.name: tunnel-0501
test-case.description: Test case that uses all four instructions (xsl:apply-templates, xsl:apply-imports, xsl:next-match and xsl:call-template) to test the accumulation of tunnel parameters.

result.assert-xml:
<out> Value of $docPar is: doc
Value of $dataPar is:data
Value of $matchPar is:match
Value of $inPar is:in</out>
